answers.answer: High blood pressure, fatigue, nausea, headaches & swelling are some i know of. Ive had all the symptoms as well but doctor said everything was fine :| it really ***** feeling this way but i guess its just normal! Good luck hope you feel better.
They say any changes in vision like seeing blurry, or if your face swells up. Those are two I didn't see mentioned on here. They thought I had it as well but after being tested it came back neg.
Everything u wrote are symptoms of preeclampsia

Pre eclampsia is diagnosed by a) protein in urine and b) blood pressure = or > 140/90mmhg. If you have these 2 things and your blood tests  (looking at PCR etc) come back abnormal then yes, a diagnosis of preeclampsia is likely. The other symptoms eg headache, swelling, blurred vision are not necessarily indicative of PET but can certainly be side effects associated with it.

Fluid retention can cause swelling and (ironically) drinking an adequate amount of water daily can help this as well ad headaches. Aim for 2 litres of water/day. Listen to your midwife - I'm sure he/she will continue to monitor you. In the meantime...relax. Your little one will be here before too long and you'll dream of the good old days when you could nap without interruption.  ;-)
Thanks everyone :) just first baby so dont know what to expect lol. Yeah I drink lots of water each day otherwise headaches are unbearable
How early on in pregnancy can you get that?

question: Hi im 37weeks and 4days pregnant with my first and was just wondering what signs I need to watch for Preclampsia. Had a checkup today with midwife. Had protein in my urine and bp was 140/80 im normally around 110/60-70. My feet and legs and lower abdomen are really swollen have been for three weeks now. Also having headaches.sent for blood tests today and midwife said came back fine. I know my midwife knows what shes doing but hard to ignore everyone in my ear. Was just wondering if anyone has had the same or what I should be watching out for before worrying.  Thanks
title: Preclampsia??
